More information: Transcript of last week’s ECB press conference with full statement of Mario Draghi https://t.co/ro6klL9B1e; explainer on the ECB’s expanded asset purchase programme https://t.co/6duDUSDXfk 8/8
Draghi: All these adjustments reflect the programme's inbuilt flexibility and the commitment to a continued smooth implementation of the programme. Our general approach has never changed. 7/
Draghi: For example, currently, the Eurosystem holdings of German securities are above the capital key, [and] holdings of Portuguese securities are below the capital key. 6/ https://t.co/bBnrBc93cK
Draghi: This is particularly relevant for reinvestments, where the amounts are sometimes distributed over three months. This can lead to temporary changes in the relative net purchase shares. 5/
Draghi: If we fall short of purchase targets in one jurisdiction for market liquidity reasons, then the shortfall is made up in others. 4/

Draghi: Focusing excessively on any particular purchase period could result in wrong interpretations. The overall stock of holdings is the relevant metric for any assessment of the programme and not recent purchase flows. 3/
Draghi: We don’t favour certain countries over others in our public sector purchase programme. Purchases are guided by the ECB's capital key, which takes into account GDP and population. 2/

(THREAD) President Mario Draghi explained the neutrality of the ECB’s asset purchases based on the capital key at last week’s ECB press conference. Here’s a thread summarising his statement. 1/ https://t.co/1t9qNdIIRe

Letter Danièle Nouy to Mr Lamberts and Mr Urtasun, MEPs, with regard to early intervention measures https://t.co/BKCRT4N6v8
https://t.co/ujqCNjPo9h
Draghi: When we recalibrated our programme in October we had to weigh confidence, versus patience and persistence
Draghi: We are not talking about deep existential differences on Governing Council. There may be disagreements on when to say certain things. That is where discipline is needed.
Draghi: Based on today’s data I can see very few chances that interest rates could be raised at all this year

Constâncio: You cannot talk about real estate bubbles, prices are close to fair value in line with fundamentals. No general over-valuation but in some countries or regions you can see excesses in prices but macroprudential measures were taken
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/iOR9OjKxZp
Draghi: We need to distinguish between sudden stop, extension of programme and gradual tapering.
Here's the IMFC statement to which Mario Draghi refers https://t.co/soMfQ709wG
Draghi: We don’t target exchange rates. They are important for growth and price stability
Draghi: The ECB doesn’t favour certain countries over others in its asset purchase programme. The overall stock, not recent purchase flows is the relevant metric
